comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: Perhaps you're right NLI but I was trying to figure how the gas got to the burner?  It's suspended on a chain and they did not trust rubber hoses in those days, they tended to perish pretty quickly!

comment._content: Nice Photo. Yes. Very Nice Classroom. I can picture Children - - -

comment.author: 41771725@N06
comment._content: Esta colección de antiguas fotos de Irlanda está resultando muy bonita e interesante.

comment.author: 23885771@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/13877445@N06] Possibly a globe lamp? They would have had a small oil lamp inside the glass globe. Such lamps were commonly in use during the late 18th and towards the mid 19th centuries, sometimes later if they survived intact. Globe lamps were also used outdoors at a gate entrance or near the front door and there are a few surviving examples in Dublin, albeit without the glass globes which vanished many years before.

comment.author: 59302818@N00
comment._content: We had flower draped statues just like those on the windows of the old whitewashed school that I attended in the 1940s.  I use to pray them to help me get through  the day without getting the cane.  On reflection I think they were all deaf.
